subject: Experienced pain in breast and felt lump in right breast during self-examination
content:
@name is a @age year old @gender presenting with pain in her right breast. She felt a lump during a self-examination.
Ordering mammography.

subject: Mammography
content:
@patient given mammography.
showed unremarkable views of the right lower outer quadrant; however only an indeterminate lymph node in the right axilla, 13 mm, was apparent. Order a right targeted spot compression breast ultrasound.

subject: Ultrasound Report
content: @patient given a right targeted spot compression breast ultrasound of a palpable lump. Image revealed a mass at 7 o’clock measuring 1.6 cm, indeterminate right axillary lymph nodes, measuring 1.4 cm with the cortex of 3 mm - indeterminate, and another measuring 12 mm with cortex of 4 mm - indeterminate

subject: Pre-chemotherapy
content:
REASON FOR VISIT:
Replace Port-A-Cath

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:
Ms. Ortiz is a 43-year-old premenopausal Hispanic woman who had an unremarkable mammogram December 3, 2013. She felt a sharp pain in her right breast about 8 months later and a palpable lump two months after that. A diagnostic mammogram on August 13, 2015, showed unremarkable views of the right lower outer quadrant; however only an indeterminate lymph node in the right axilla, 13 mm, was apparent. A right targeted spot compression breast ultrasound of the palpable lump on August 29, 2015 revealed a mass at 7 o’clock measuring 1.6 cm, indeterminate right axillary lymph nodes, measuring 1.4 cm with the cortex of 3 mm - indeterminate, and another measuring 12 mm with cortex of 4 mm - indeterminate.
She underwent right breast mass core biopsy and right axillary lymph node core biopsy on August 29, 2015 which revealed infiltrating poorly differentiated ductal carcinoma, grade 3, estrogen receptor 0, progesterone receptor weakly positive 1% to 4%, HER2 was negative 0%, and Ki-67 ranged 85% to 95%. Right axillary lymph node was negative for malignancy. Stage IA T1c N0 M0 disease. BRCA1/2 testing was negative.
In preparation for treatment, a Port-A-Cath was placed on October 13, 2015. TTE done on October 15, 2015 showed normal systolic function, with ejection fraction 60-65% and trace mitral regurgitation.

She underwent neoadjuvant cyclophosphamide (ddAC) followed by paclitaxel (T) from October 20, 2015 to February 23, 2016. Paclitaxel was dose reduced to 60mg/m2 for the last 2 cycles and stopped after 11 doses due to Grade 3 neuropathy.  She received 11 of 12 planned doses.

She underwent right lumpectomy with Dr. Ford on March 12, 2016. Pathology report on March 16, 2016 showed no residual disease, 0/2 SLNs, pathological complete response pCR, stage pT0N0.

She completed adjuvant radiation therapy with Dr. Bruno from May 18, 2016 to June 29, 2016.

She started Tamoxifen July 6, 2016.

A bilateral 3D mammogram on September 15, 2016 showed benign findings.
Her annual gynecologic exam with her PCP on January 6, 2017 was unremarkable.

Due to her history of mammographically occult disease, she underwent a surveillance breast MRI with contrast on June 10, 2017, revealing stable post-treatment changes of the right breast, no abnormality of the left breast, and enhancement of of two internal mammary lymph nodes of the right breast, measuring 1.5 cm by 1.0 cm and 1.8 cm by 1.0 cm. 

CT of the chest with contrast June 20, 2017 revealed four indeterminate pulmonary nodules, 4 to 5 mm in diameter, in the right lung and postsurgical changes in the right breast and axilla. CT of the abdomen and pelvis with contrast on June 20, 2017 revealed two hypodensities in the left lobe of the liver that were consistent with benign cysts. A bone scan June 28, 2017 was negative for skeletal metastases.

Cytologic examination of a biopsy specimen of an enlarged internal mammary lymph node of the right breast, obtained June 20, 2017 on CT-guided fine-needle aspiration, revealed tumor cells that histologically resembled cells from the patient’s prior breast cancer. The hormone receptor status of these metastatic cells was ER-negative, PR-positive, and HER2-positive.

Tamoxifen was stopped June 27, 2017.


ASSESSMENT:
A Port-A-Cath was replaced today.
She will start induction chemotherapy with trastuzumab and paclitaxel due to low volume of metastatic disease, beginning on July 17, 2017.

subject: Treatment Check-in
content:
REASON FOR VISIT:
Treatment Progress

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:
Ms. Ortiz is a 43-year-old premenopausal Hispanic woman who had an unremarkable mammogram December 3, 2013. She felt a sharp pain in her right breast about 8 months later and a palpable lump two months after that. A diagnostic mammogram on August 13, 2015, showed unremarkable views of the right lower outer quadrant; however only an indeterminate lymph node in the right axilla, 13 mm, was apparent. She completed adjuvant radiation therapy with Dr. Bruno from May 18, 2016 to June 29, 2016.

She started Tamoxifen July 6, 2016.

A bilateral 3D mammogram on September 15, 2016 showed benign findings.
Her annual gynecologic exam with her PCP on January 6, 2017 was unremarkable.

Due to her history of mammographically occult disease, she underwent a surveillance breast MRI with contrast on June 10, 2017, revealing stable post-treatment changes of the right breast, no abnormality of the left breast, and enhancement of of two internal mammary lymph nodes of the right breast, measuring 1.5 cm by 1.0 cm and 1.8 cm by 1.0 cm. 

CT of the chest with contrast June 20, 2017 revealed four indeterminate pulmonary nodules, 4 to 5 mm in diameter, in the right lung and postsurgical changes in the right breast and axilla. CT of the abdomen and pelvis with contrast on June 20, 2017 revealed two hypodensities in the left lobe of the liver that were consistent with benign cysts. A bone scan June 28, 2017 was negative for skeletal metastases.

Cytologic examination of a biopsy specimen of an enlarged internal mammary lymph node of the right breast, obtained June 20, 2017 on CT-guided fine-needle aspiration, revealed tumor cells that histologically resembled cells from the patient’s prior breast cancer. The hormone receptor status of these metastatic cells was ER-negative, PR-positive, and HER2-positive.

Tamoxifen was stopped June 27, 2017.

A Port-A-Cath was replaced on July 10, 2017.
She underwent induction chemotherapy with trastuzumab and paclitaxel due to low volume of metastatic disease, beginning on July 17, 2017.

ASSESSMENT:
Although her #disease status is #stable #as of #10/30/2017, recommending to halt after 5 cycles due to #toxicity #Grade 3 #myalgia and #toxicity #Grade 3 #peripheral motor neuropathy attributed to paclitaxel.

subject: Review of CT Scan
content:
REASON FOR VISIT:
CT Scan Results Review

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:
Ms. Ortiz is a 43-year-old premenopausal Hispanic woman who had an unremarkable mammogram December 3, 2013. She felt a sharp pain in her right breast about 8 months later and a palpable lump two months after that. A diagnostic mammogram on August 13, 2015, showed unremarkable views of the right lower outer quadrant; however only an indeterminate lymph node in the right axilla, 13 mm, was apparent. A right targeted spot compression breast ultrasound of the palpable lump on August 29, 2015 revealed a mass at 7 o’clock measuring 1.6 cm, indeterminate right axillary lymph nodes, measuring 1.4 cm with the cortex of 3 mm - indeterminate, and another measuring 12 mm with cortex of 4 mm - indeterminate.
She underwent right breast mass core biopsy and right axillary lymph node core biopsy on August 29, 2015 which revealed infiltrating poorly differentiated ductal carcinoma, grade 3, estrogen receptor 0, progesterone receptor weakly positive 1% to 4%, HER2 was negative 0%, and Ki-67 ranged 85% to 95%. Right axillary lymph node was negative for malignancy. Stage IA T1c N0 M0 disease. BRCA1/2 testing was negative.
In preparation for treatment, a Port-A-Cath was placed on October 13, 2015. TTE done on October 15, 2015 showed normal systolic function, with ejection fraction 60-65% and trace mitral regurgitation.

She underwent neoadjuvant cyclophosphamide (ddAC) followed by paclitaxel (T) from October 20, 2015 to February 23, 2016. Paclitaxel was dose reduced to 60mg/m2 for the last 2 cycles and stopped after 11 doses due to Grade 3 neuropathy.  She received 11 of 12 planned doses.

She underwent right lumpectomy with Dr. Ford on March 12, 2016. Pathology report on March 16, 2016 showed no residual disease, 0/2 SLNs, pathological complete response pCR, stage pT0N0.

She completed adjuvant radiation therapy with Dr. Bruno from May 18, 2016 to June 29, 2016.

She started Tamoxifen July 6, 2016.

A bilateral 3D mammogram on September 15, 2016 showed benign findings.
Her annual gynecologic exam with her PCP on January 6, 2017 was unremarkable.

Due to her history of mammographically occult disease, she underwent a surveillance breast MRI with contrast on June 10, 2017, revealing stable post-treatment changes of the right breast, no abnormality of the left breast, and enhancement of of two internal mammary lymph nodes of the right breast, measuring 1.5 cm by 1.0 cm and 1.8 cm by 1.0 cm. 

CT of the chest with contrast June 20, 2017 revealed four indeterminate pulmonary nodules, 4 to 5 mm in diameter, in the right lung and postsurgical changes in the right breast and axilla. CT of the abdomen and pelvis with contrast on June 20, 2017 revealed two hypodensities in the left lobe of the liver that were consistent with benign cysts. A bone scan June 28, 2017 was negative for skeletal metastases.

Cytologic examination of a biopsy specimen of an enlarged internal mammary lymph node of the right breast, obtained June 20, 2017 on CT-guided fine-needle aspiration, revealed tumor cells that histologically resembled cells from the patient’s prior breast cancer. The hormone receptor status of these metastatic cells was ER-negative, PR-positive, and HER2-positive.

Tamoxifen was stopped June 27, 2017.

A Port-A-Cath was replaced on July 10, 2017.
She underwent induction chemotherapy with trastuzumab and paclitaxel due to low volume of metastatic disease, beginning on July 17, 2017. Although her disease status was stable as of October 30, 2017, therapy was halted after 5 cycles due to Grade 3 myalgia and Grade 3 peripheral neuropathy attributed to paclitaxel. 

ASSESSMENT:
Contrast enhanced CT of the Chest revealed pulmonary nodules, 4 to 5 mm in diameter, in the right lung and postsurgical changes in the right breast and axilla
